intro: Diplostephium schultzii f. subincisum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on long, slender peduncles. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
